TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IConfigMapPath

Docs.summary: Provides access to the mapping between configuration-file virtual and physical paths.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

Docs.param: A unique identifier for the site.
The URL associated with the site.
Docs.summary: Gets the virtual-directory name associated with a specific site.
Docs.returns: The must be unique. No two sites share the same id. The distinguishes sites that have the same name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.GetAppPathForPath%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public void ResolveSiteArgument (string siteArgument, out string siteName, out string siteID);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ResolveSiteArgument(string siteArgument, [out] string& siteName, [out] string& siteID) cil managed
Public Sub ResolveSiteArgument (siteArgument As String, ByRef siteName As String, ByRef siteID As String)
public: void ResolveSiteArgument(System::String ^ siteArgument, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::String ^ % siteName, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::String ^ % siteID);
abstract member ResolveSiteArgument : string * * -> unit

Docs.param: The site name or site identifier.
A unique identifier for the site.
Docs.summary: Populates the site name and site ID based on a site argument value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If `siteArgument` is `null`, is equal to the default site name, or is equal to the default site identifier, the `siteName` and `siteID` are populated with the default site values.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.ResolveSiteArgument%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
